item.title: FragPunk Player Count: How Many People Are Playing FragPunk in 2025?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/fragpunk-current-player-count/

FragPunk is a fresh tactical hero shooter with a unique twist, and the debut title from Bad Guitar Studio is already attracting a steadily growing player count in 2025.

There’s certainly no shortage of live-service online multiplayer titles, and in recent years there’s been an increase in tactical shooters and hero shooters. FragPunk falls under both categories, so how well is it doing in attracting players? The game only just released on March 6th, but the early results for FragPunk are pretty positive.

FragPunk Player Count (March 2025)

FragPunk’s player count peaked at 113,946 players on Steam during the game’s opening weekend. In the game’s first three full days, FragPunk reached a new peak each day: 63,958 players on March 7th, 85,203 on March 8th, and 113,946 on March 9th. Almost more impressively, FragPunk drew a player peak of over 100,000 players on March 10th on a Monday.

Currently, the numbers for FragPunk are only for PC players on Steam. Just before the game’s PC launch, the devs announced that the console versions for PS5 and Xbox had been delayed due to “unexpected technical challenges in optimization and adaptation.” The console release for FragPunk has now been pushed back to an undetermined date.

Is FragPunk Worth Playing?

As a free-to-play game trying something new in the hero/tactical shooter space, FragPunk is certainly worth trying and playing in 2025.

What sets FragPunk apart from other shooters in the genre is its reliance on Shard Cards. In the game’s standard mode reminiscent of CS2, VALORANT, and Call of Duty’s Search & Destroy mode, the attacking team attempts to plant a Converter at a site while the other team defends. Players earn Shard points, and a team can use those points on Shard Cards in between rounds for unique buffs and effects. There are 169 different Shard Cards, each with its own unique effect. These effects range from basic movement or damage buffs to a “Turtleback” that blocks bullets from behind, or a snow effect that lets players slide around the map.

For the collector types, there are weapon skins, Lancer skins, stickers, and emotes to collect.

For more information on player numbers, check out the 2025 player count figures for Call of Duty Warzone, Fortnite, and Marvel Rivals too.

item.title: Postal 2 Is Getting a VR Port 22 Years After Its Release
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/postal-2-is-getting-a-vr-port-22-years-after-its-release/

Postal 2 is back for a brand new audience. Developer Running with Scissors has revealed Postal 2 VR for PlayStation VR2, Steam VR, and Meta Quest.

The VR port comes 22 years after the game’s original release in 2003.

“For the first time ever, POSTAL 2 is fully reimagined for VR, bringing its dark humor, open-world mayhem, and unapologetic absurdity to an entirely new level,” the game’s description reads. “Step into the well-worn boots of The POSTAL Dude, a hapless everyman just trying to get through the week in the bizarre town of Paradise, Arizona. Whether you choose to play it cool or go completely POSTAL is entirely up to you.”

PODCAST: The Future Of Call of Duty—Insider Gaming Weekly

According to the developers, the game will “take full advantage of virtual reality”.

“Feel every reload with manual weapon handling, interact with NPCs like never before using gesture-based reactions, and navigate the chaos with an overhauled inventory and minimap system designed specifically for VR,” they said.

“This is POSTAL 2 like you’ve never experienced before—fully unhinged, wildly immersive, and ready to let you loose in the most chaotic VR playground imaginable.”

An official release date will be announced in the future. In the mean time, you can check out the official reveal trailer for the game, below.
